author: Sune Engel Rasmussen
title: Syrian Offensive Creates New Frictions Among Foreign Powers
text:
A Syrian government campaign to wrest one of the last autonomous pockets in the country from rebels is raising tensions among foreign powers positioned on different sides of the six-year conflict.
Idlib province is home to a wide range of groups opposed to President Bashar al-Assad. His efforts to crush rebels there come after his government successfully reasserted control over large parts of the country, thanks to firepower from the regimeâ€™s Russian and Iranian allies. 
...
